answerText: Golan Heights or Golan Plateau [accept Al-Jawlan or Ramat ha-Golan][10] Since 1967, the Golan Heights have been occupied by this nation, which annexed it in 1981, although Syria still claims it.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Northwestern A | 9 | Geography | None | College
subject: Geography
question: Question: This region contains parts of Mt. Hermon, whose summit is shared between two neighbors to the north. For 10 points each: [10] Name this area stretching from Mt. Hermon in the north to a lake known locally as the Kinneret in the southwest.
